H0.text: What name is given to describes the phenomenon of the gradual mixing of two different substances which are in contact. Interblend

H1.text: What name is given to describes the phenomenon of the gradual mixing of two different substances which are in contact. Commingle

H2.text: What name is given to describes the phenomenon of the gradual mixing of two different substances which are in contact. Permeate

H3.text: What name is given to describes the phenomenon of the gradual mixing of two different substances which are in contact. Diffuse

A4.text: Diffusion is the net movement of anything (for example, atoms, ions, molecules, energy) generally from a region of higher concentration to a region of lower concentration.

A5.text: the central idea of diffusion, however, is common to all of these: a substance or collection undergoing diffusion spreads out from a point or location at which there is a higher concentration of that substance or collection.
